page.title: 08HISTORICAL FEATURES
page.content: {Dunbar Castle}was built on a rocky headland and belonged to the Earls of Dunbar who were established in Dunbar after the Norman Conquest in England .In the 15th Century the Earldom was confiscated and reverted to the Crown.By 1523 a blockhouse was built on the landward side of the Castle and was the most modern in Europe at the time.Some of the fortifications were destroyed by Order of Parliament following Quenn Mary's abdication. Further destruction followed when the new entrance channel for the Victoria Harbour was cut. {The Battery}was built in 1781 on Lammer Island.It had a rounded front, which faced seaward,pierced by embrasures for the main armaments.It was later used as a hospital
